== Who I am ==

My name is Hui Wang, and I have been a member of the Ubuntu Kernel Team
since July 2013. In the first 8 years at Canonical, I worked on PC OEM
projects, then I switched to work on ARM64/ARM HWE IoT kernels in the
recent 3 years.

I got a master degree on "signal and information processing" from Chinese Academy of Science,
and before joining the Canonical, I worked as a software engineer for Chinese software academy
of science, Sunplus and WindRiver.

== My Ubuntu story ==

My first experience with Ubuntu Linux is in 2008, in that year, I joined
WindRiver as a wrlinux BSP engineer, I started installing the ubuntu 8.04
to my personal laptop, It is amazing to use the open source OS, I could
install apps with a couple of commands, and I could even build my own kernel
to replace the default one, from then on, I moved my interest to the linux
kernel and the whole linux ecosystem.

=== My involvement ===

Right now, I am mainly working on the HWE IoT arm64/arm kernels, something like focal:linux-shiner and jammy:linux-ein. In the past, I also worked on PC linux-oem kernels and audio stack packages like pulseaudio, alsa-lib and gnome-settings-daemon.
